name: Holiday Inn Asheville Biltmore East

reviews.text: My mom and I booked this hotel through Biltmore as part of their Bed and Breakfast package. We couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was extremely friendly, warm and inviting lobby and neat/clean rooms. I enjoyed snagging a couple of homemade cookies each night while getting directions for various locations about Asheville. Convenient to getting to downtown Asheville and Biltmore. A car is a must but directions were easy especially with all the local maps and desk staff to help.
reviews.title: enjoyed our stay, booked through Biltmore package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as pets, NC looks like a very pet-friendly state from all the hotels who allow pets. We weren't aware of any pets and the few we saw outside doing their business we did not hear them inside.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!!

likes.liked: — nice staff, affordable, great pet friendly rooms, easy location from highway, not scary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were just passing through Asheville with our dog and were very worried about staying at a "pet-friendly" hotel. Well, we couldn't believe how nice this hotel was (for a passing-through hotel) and the "pet room" wasn't different then any other room.... no smell, stains or anything to think a dog has stayed there. The staff was great and we had a lovely dinner at the hotel restaurant (try the parmigiana or lasagna). We will definitely be back with or without our dog. We were pleasantly surprised!
reviews.title: Beware of some problem areas!

likes.disliked: — They allow dogs in the rooms & no free breakfast offered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this property Nov 2 -4, 2007. Lobby area was very warm and inviting, staff very friendly. However, there are some problem areas. Beware that this is a pet-friendly hotel, this translates to LOTS of dogs! We could hear barking several times during the night, not consistent barking but enough to be an annoying. Another point that needs to be addressed is the VERY loud air conditioner. The air conditioner ran almost all night but it never got cold inside the room. The temperatures outside were in the 40's to 50's yet the air conditioner was always running. Cookies were provided in the lobby area but they were horrible! Elevators were incredibley slow and to top it all off this hotel does not offer a free breakfast! I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value for clean, comfortable room.

reviews.text: Very helpful staff - take good care of us.
reviews.title: Clean room, friendly staff

reviews.text: October 27, 2008
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Our small group booked 11 rooms for a 3 nt fall weekend in Asheville. Having read most of the reviews, it was certain to be a good experience. The hotel staff was ready for us when we arrived in the early evening. Outdoor tables and chairs had tableclothes with lit candles upon our arrival. Rooms were located together and the wine and hors d'oeuvres reception we had pre-arranged was organized to perfection. The staff in the hotel and restaurant went out of their way to give great service. We did eat a couple of dinners in the restaurant because of the excellent service, the delicious food and the ambience, which was truly inviting. The lobby was decorated for the fall season, complete with fire in hearth. There were nice touches of hot coffee/tea and cookies each afternoon in the lobby; and a convenient computer/printer desk. Having a USA Today paper outside the door was welcome. The WiFi rooms are decorated attractively and everyone raved about the bedding. Bathrooms had granite shower/tub and sink. Each room had a microwave and refrigerator. Depending on the room, some of the views were great. Though we were a little bit away from downtown Asheville, the positive experience at the hotel made up for the drive. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nothing special about this place

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night;. Was a little disappointed in the room, as it seemed small, cramped and somewhat drab. Definitely overpriced for the amenities offered. Stayed at the Residences at Biltmore the next few nights. and even though it was twice the price as this hotel, it was well worth it. Residences at Biltore were fabulous!
reviews.title: great staff!

reviews.text: we stayed here from the reviews we read on tripadvisor that it was very dog-friendly, and they were right. very friendly and helpful staff, and the room did not smell or look like pets had stayed there. we stayed on the first floor(pet friendly) and it was nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel/ Great Location

likes.liked: — great mountain view and kid-proof room

reviews.text: We were up the road from the Blue Ridge Parkway which had some good walking trials for the dog and us. I would say the only reason we did not rate our stay as excellent was the room service food,very expensive for what we ordered and quite bland.
reviews.title: Great Accommodations & Good Location

likes.disliked: — Minor gripe - construction going on in the checkin area

reviews.title: Very nice, probably will return
reviews.text: We only stayed one night but the king, whirlpool bed room was very nice.

reviews.title: Pet Friendly, Nice Rooms, Great Location. Nice Staff. A Gem!
reviews.text: Nice view from the room, considering the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was only one small problem,the occasional loud vehicle from the nearby highway.
reviews.title: A True Gem

likes.liked: — The comfortable rooms and the friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise it was perfect.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel & pet friendly

reviews.text: Clean, updated and as far as I could tell no pets were kept in our room.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

likes.disliked: — Would of been better if it was closer tho the Biltmore Village

reviews.title: ok but a few points worth considering before you decide
reviews.text: We had a 4 night stay here in September. Probably easiest to summarise our stay in plusses and minuses and let individuals decide.

reviews.title: Wow-what a neat retreat hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Asheville Biltmore East Hotel
description: The award winning Holiday Inn Hotel Asheville- Biltmore East at the Blue Ridge Parkway provides the warmth and charm of a mountain lodge with the quality and service you've come to expect from Holiday Inns. The Holiday Inn Asheville - Biltmore East is only minutes away from national chain restaurants, movie theaters, the Blue Ridge Parkway entrance and only 7 minutes from the Biltmore Estate and Historic Downtown Asheville. Enjoy our spacious mountain view rooms that overlook our scenic, seasonal heated outdoor pool, special executive corporate rooms designed for the business traveler, or traveling with your pet, ask for one of our pet friendly rooms with only a $20.00 pet fee per night. Nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains and within minutes of the area's most popular attractions and destinations: Biltmore Estate, the Blue Ridge Parkway, Historic Downtown Asheville, Chimney Rock Park, Antique Malls, Black Mountain, Montreat, Warren Wilson College, VA Hospital, and across the street from Billy Graham's Training Center, 'The Cove'. Conveniently located on I-40 East or West at Exit 55.
